titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 7) to amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to provide more effective remedies to victims of discrimination in the payment of wages on the basis of sex, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 124) expressing opposition to banning service in the Armed Forces by openly transgender individuals.

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 7) to amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to provide more effective remedies to victims of discrimination in the payment of wages on the basis of sex, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 124) expressing opposition to banning service in the Armed Forces by openly transgender individuals.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 116-19, by Mrs. Torres (CA).
The resolution provides for one hour debate on H.R. 7 and H.Res. 124.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 13.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 252.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 231 - 192 (Roll no. 130).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 232 - 190 (Roll no. 131).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 7) to amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to provide more effective remedies to victims of discrimination in the payment of wages on the basis of sex, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 124) expressing opposition to banning service in the Armed Forces by openly transgender individuals.
